title: Date Failed / Add-ons Update Failed
content:
I seem to have a problem with the dates in my browser. This has caused the weAutoPagerize add-on to stop working properly. This add-on to connects to a database to update itself. The problem, as the attached image indicates, is that my browser tells the add-on that the date is 12/31/1969, which means that it cannot be updated.

I've also tried the uAutoPagerize add-on, which uses the same database, and has the same problem.

It seems this problem originated when I had to restore my system. However, I already checked the date and time on my computer, and they are correct. It should be noted that this problem only occurs in my portable Firefox. In my desktop version any of the two add-on mentioned above work normally.

What could I do to fix this problem?

Thank you for your answers.
creator: 7u66es5qvg

title: Firefox keeps asking for the master password even though I only use sync for bookmarks
content:
Every time shortly after starting Firefox, it asks me for the master password. I've read that it has to do with synchronisation via a Firefox account and the saved login credentials for that account. But I use sync exclusively for bookmarks, not for logins.

Is there a way to use the master password, use sync for bookmarks, but prevent Firefox from pestering me with the master password when I don't need to log in to a website?
creator: charvat.k

title: Firefox browser won't load no matter what I do.
content:
I've had this browser installed on my computer for about a year. It is worth noting that, all of the browsers worked perfectly fine before. However, after roughly 3 weeks of regularly seeing that all of the browsers on my Windows 10 PC (Opera, Firefox, Tor) except Chrome browser don't seem to start up. When I run Firefox.exe, it opens for a fraction of a second, displays a text box, and then closes. I tried recording my screen to understand what's written more clearly, and it said "Profile Missing". But not the familiar profile missing error. this one closes immediately, and with no text, only the title. It is also important to mention that all of the files associated with the browser also won't open, except helper.exe. For example, this command "C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe" -P to open the profile manager will show the same error.

Things I tried:

1. Refreshing the browser. 2. Uninstalling and reinstalling. 3. Removing the appdata profiles folder. 4. Installing other versions of Firefox. 5. Scanning for malware with 3 different Antivirus programs.

And so far non of these methods worked. I would like to get an answer on how to fix this. Thanks.
creator: alonalush5

title: When I view my Talktalk   My Account  no details are displayed. If I switch to MS Edge it all displays OK.
content: When I view my Talktalk My Account no details are displayed. If I switch to MS Edge it all displays OK. Any ideas?
creator: bob.locke

title: Dark popup after recent update
content: After a recent update the firefox popups (right click menu, alerts, etc...) are black instead of the usual light gray. How can I restore the previous color? Thank you
creator: steluci

title: Firefox was working find earlier in Kali but suddenly after using burpsuite firefox and TOR are not working.
content: Firefox was working fine earlier in Kali but suddenly after using burpsuite firefox and TOR are not working. Resetted the Burpsuite still unable to use firefox. Tried with proxy of Burpsuite (Manual proxy configuration) and firefox works fine. Without setting the proxy (system proxt setting) the firefox is not working
creator: ipcnfg

title: somethingsdfsdf
content:
Why is this so temperamental: when opening fresh Firefox, it opens with a different page EVERY TIME???

Sometimes it opens with my Homepage, which I have set up deliberately and purposefully to open with my Homepage, which is DuckDuckGo. That’s why I set it up: to open with it every time I open Firefox. To have this certainty. I want it to open with my home page EVERY TIME, not just randomly.

Sometimes it opens with my Homepage, most of the time it does not.

Sometimes it opens with this annoying message how it cannot open previous sessions – I never asked it to open previous sessions!

Sometimes it indeed opens with a page from my last session – I don’t want it to open my previous session!

Sometimes it opens with just a standard “new tab” page – I never told it that either.

What is the problem with opening the Homepage EVERY TIME I start Firefox?

Does Firefox have any concept of how extremely annoying this is?

From the attached photo, what exactly is required here, other than entering the page I want for the Homepage???
creator: md324667

title: Be nice. Our volunteers are Mozilla users just like you, who take the time out of their day to help.
content: Firefox Ask your question Be descriptive. Saying “playing video on YouTube is always choppy” will help us understand the issue better than saying “something is wrong” or “the app is broken”.
creator: mdjavedboosedqpd

title: Send file to open with Firefox should do automaticaly need not the PopUp Windows for "What should Firefox do with this file" again!
content:
Hello all,

I use a PLM Data Software and send a file to Firefox, and every time a popup window come up "What should Firefox do with this file"?

In other browsers I have a second Icon too to click on "save this setting and trust every time" if you open this file typ again. After this setting I can send direct to Firefox and no popup window come up again.

Best regards, Torsten.
creator: torsten.runge

title: How often do you use the Next/Previous thread links?
content: A problem has been identified with the next and previous thread links. Links to threads have to be accompanied by the topic offset parameter in order for them to work, which is annoying because then threads won't be seen as visited. If we want to resolve the problem, we can either fix it or simply remove the next and previous features (which would be easier). Is this feature used by anyone?
creator: almas77sajid

title: Cannot restore default theme.
content:
I fiddled with themes and now all my tabs have different highlight colours. I've tried to restore to default but without success.

As I use multiple windows, I was hoping to have a different simple pastel highlight colour for each window, not for each tab. Otherwise how do I get back to the original default? The on-line instructions do not work.
creator: LCL999

title: Firefox Unable to load pages, or show any response at all
content:
Well firefox was fine yesterday, today i open my computer up and it will not load anything. No home screen, type something in it doesnt try to load. I cannot open settings, i can click it, but it does nothing (the hamburger drop down works)

I have: Checked firewall Reinstalled firefox 3 times, to default settings x2 Restarted my computer x2 Shut down my computer Reinstalled microsoft visual c++ 2015-2022 Updated windows Shut down firefox many times within task manager Refreshed firefox Clear startup cache Safe mode (forefox) Checked antivirus (Not in order)

Edge works fine, but firefox is goofy.

Pc information: Amd ryzen 5 3600 6-core 16.0gb ram 64bit Windows 10 home Version 21H2 Osbuild: 19043.1526 Ethernet connection (also tried wireless, same results) 1tb free space

Firefox information: 97.0

The picture is about as much as it’ll do, sorry for the photo of screen, i am typing this on mobile
creator: toddo212213

title: Block due to security issue
content:
I have recently been blocked from down loading info from what has always been a safe site. It is the PEOPLES MAGAZINE ROYALS website. I receive the following message:

'''''' Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue

Firefox detected a potential security threat and did not continue to l.mail.people.com because this website requires a secure connection. bold text What can you do about it?

l.mail.people.com has a security policy called HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), which means that Firefox can only connect to it securely. You can’t add an exception to visit this site.

The issue is most likely with the website, and there is nothing you can do to resolve it. You can notify the website’s administrator about the problem.


This came from: 

People Royals <people@mail.people.com>

Unsubscribe To:stmitchell20042004@yahoo.com People Magazine people.com

Can you help me ascertain what is blocking my access to the articles from this website. It indicates a security problem.
creator: stmitchell20042004

title: dongle not working
content: my dongle is not working. I've tried to restart the computer and took the dongle out for 10 econds but still getting issues. it would be opening as normal at the start for like 10 seconds then it crashes saying there is an issue. i really need help. thanks
creator: huss1313

title: Browser on Laptop suddenly stop displaying under search bar
content:
My firefox on my laptop was working just fine until it stopped displaying anything under the search bar. I tried reloading, End Tasking the browser, Refreshing the Install, Uninstall re-install, reboot computer and nothing is letting my laptop firefox display.

it wont even let me access settings or other menu options. It sometimes books up troubleshoot mode but that also has the same issues.

laptop is windows 10 lenovo. firefox is 97.0 64bit version. was working 2 hours ago.....
creator: smuwen

title: Firefox can not access ANY websites
content: All the sudden, Firefox stopped being able to access any website. How do I fix?
creator: jon114

title: Where are the Icons or tiles for New Tab? They disappeared after update.
content:
Hi,

Another bad change for me after last update. When I click on the NEW Tab I don't see the icons or tiles of my most used websites anymore . Only the top search bar and a down menu with the 10 most used websites. Where did the tiles go?

The article Customize your New Tab page to hide or display content doesn't work . I cannot get into settings to change anything. Is there another solution???? I would like my tiles back.

Thank you,

Amy
creator: Amylogamy

title: Address Bar Settings
content:
Hey, so i've been editing my address bar settings in firefox to customize it.

However one thing i can't quite work out is when you go into privacy & security and scroll down to the following

Address Bar

  • When using the address bar, suggest

(Search Engines) - When this is unticked what exactly does it do? - As it doesn't seem to change anything.

Any insight would be appreciated.
creator: john718

title: Can't sync from OSX 10.14 to new OSX 12.2.1 computer
content:
Among the many combinations I've tried: login on old computer, click "sync now" (to push most recent version of everything I want), launch FF on new computer, sign in, click "sync now". Nothing visibly changes on the new machine (no new tabs open), but I can see "recent bookmarks", what either most or all of the stored bookmarks, and what appears to be most but not all of the browsing history. What's needed to restore tabs?

This directory is empty: Index of file:///Users/buggy/Library/Application Support/Firefox/Profiles/6vc9xd36.default-release/weave/logs/

FF version 97.0 on both machines.

I also want to make sure I understand this process. I have dozens of tabs and thousands of bookmarks on the old machine (longtime fan, first time caller). When I launch FF for the first time on the new machine, login, and click "sync now", what is getting written to the server? The SUM of the tabs on the new machine (a half dozen "why doesn't sync work" windows) and the old machine, OR just the tabs on the new machine, as it is the most recently logged in and sync'd?

Thank you for any help you can offer.
creator: buggyisalreadytaken

title: Firefox won’t open
content: When closing Firefox after fresh install or computer restart, the app will not open and instead opens in the background as 7 different processes, also when it does open after fresh install or restart, no websites will load nor can I access any setting or options for Firefox itself, I tried to install an old update from 2017 I had saved and that installation worked fine including accessing setting and websites, but after closing the app and opening it again, the problem came back
creator: bmbimer

title: Repeated request to sign into Firefox on pop up
content: Hi, Please excuse my explanation of how I word my issue but I'm an old duck & have trouble keeping up with all things technical........ok.... here goes... When I double click on the Firefox icon on my computer, the page loads & then a little box pops up in the middle of the page requesting me to sign into Firefox with my password which I do & click sign in, then the little box pops up again requesting me to sign into Firefox again. This repeatedly happens no matter how many times I sign in that darn little pop up box keeps asking me to sign in again & again & again, etc, etc, etc........ Please help because my brain is turning to mush. I'd be so grateful for any help and/or advice you can offer me. Kind regards, Maggie Wildash
creator: wildash

title: Installation on MacBook Pro (2011)
content:
When I downloaded Firefox, it did not automatically open a window on my desktop. I drug the file from my Download folder to the Applications folder. Then double-clicked and opened the Firefox window where your instructions say to "Eject Firefox". After doing that, I don't see anywhere to Open Firefox. I tried it again from the icon in the Applications folder, but I just get the same small window where your instructions say to "Eject Firefox".

Note: at no point in this process did the Firefox icon change to the bright orange/red "swoosh", as pictured in your instructions. Mine remains a generic grey box icon.

I read your system requirements and I believe I meet them. I am using Mac OS High Sierra Version 10.13.6.

I went through this process three times and restarted my computer in between. Can someone please call me for help. [removed phone# from public]
creator: pawlowski.gin

title: Firefox Release 97 8th Feb Completely Broken on My System
content:
Long story short, today I received v97. Firefox would no longer open websites. Settings would not open. about:config would not open. Tried killing my profiles. Complete clean installs. None of it worked. Something is 100% wrong with v97, at least for my system. I can install 94 no problem. 96.0.3 no problem. As soon as 97 hits, everything breaks.

I love firefox and would love to troubleshoot the issue, but it's not possible. Most of the time, v97 won't even open, so launching the troubleshooter mode is impossible. And if it does open, selecting troubleshooter results in a crash.

No idea if any of this is helpful, but this is what one of them spat out:

creator: matthewjmatthiesen

title: print.save_print_settings=false not working in v97.0
content: I don't want Firefox to remember the last-used printer. As of v97.0 the printer comes up as the last one I used. I have print.save_print_settings=false. Is it broken?
creator: vesfatica

title: Firefox not loading or opening after uninstalling and removing everything
content: Firefox won't open so I went and uninstalled it and reinstalled it and it won't load anything and is just stuck on the white screen with the address bar. My firefox account works with my phone and other laptop, so I do not know what the issue is.
creator: wfmikitin

title: Why is Firefox not honoring my SSL website certificate.
content:
Why is Firefox not honoring my SSL certificate. GoDaddy is telling us everything is set up correctly. Firefox seems to be the only browser not working. The timeclock on my MacBook pro is correct and I am using the most current OS.

Thanks!
creator: drmary85
